fields.question: Q. What is an academic year?
fields.answer: Normally the academic year begins in the last week of August and ends the second week in May.

fields.question: What is Upper Level Matriculation?
fields.answer: This is referred to as Normal Matriculation. The applicant would have satisfied the University and the Faculty’s requirements for matriculation. Upper Level Matriculation is offered to students who are qualified to do their degrees over three years.

fields.question: Can I change my registration from Full-time to Part-time and vice versa?
fields.answer: Yes. A request for a change of status can be done via the Student Administration System (SAS). Final approval will then be given by the Dean or his Nominee.

fields.question: Can I register for courses in other Faculties?
fields.answer: Yes. However, approval will only be granted by the Faculty in which the course is offered.

fields.question: Can I do a major or minor in another Faculty?
fields.answer: Yes.  In addition to the Faculty’s major a student can do a major or one or two minors from other Faculties.  Out-of-Faculty majors and minors are governed by the regulations of the Faculty which offers the programme.

fields.question: What do I do if I am having timetable clashes?
fields.answer: Students are expected to select their courses carefully and where there are time conflicts, speak to a Department/Course representative to ascertain what alternate arrangements can be made.

fields.question: Where can I get information about the outline for courses offered within the Faculty?
fields.answer: You can get information about course offered by visiting the Faculty’s website at http://myspot.mona.uwi.edu/fpas/  as well as the Faculty’s Handbook.

fields.question: How do I ‘Voluntarily Withdraw’ from the University?
fields.answer: By making an online request through SAS via the Automated Student Request Module (ARSM).

fields.question: If I withdraw (voluntarily or mandatory) from the University, will I be allowed to return?
fields.answer: Yes. You can return after one academic year. However, you must reapply to the University.

fields.question: Q. What are the differences between undergraduate and graduate courses?
fields.answer: Undergraduate courses are required for the completion of a Bachelor or Associate Degree while graduate courses use undergraduate degree as a pre-requisite requirement.

fields.question: Q. What are the Class of Degrees that are offered by the University to students in the Faculty of Science and Technology?
fields.answer: A.  The Class of Degrees:

fields.question: What happens if I missed an examination?
fields.answer: Candidates who are absent from an examination are asked to check with the Examinations Section.  For further information visit the Examinations Section at:

fields.question: What are the different types of Examinations in the Faculty of Science and Technology?
fields.answer: All examinations shall be conducted by means of any one or more of the following:

fields.question: Does the Faculty offers a summer programme for students who wish to complete the programme early?
fields.answer: Yes.  The Faculty offers a number of courses in the summer during between June and July. This information is accessible through the Faculty’s notice boards and website.

fields.question: How do I participate in the University’s Student Exchange Programme?
fields.answer: If you:

fields.question: What is the purpose of the Grade Point Average (GPA)?
fields.answer: The GPA is the mechanism used for determining the Class of Degrees. It allows students and graduates to link easily with programmes in other institutions around the world. For further information visit the website:

fields.question: What is Academic Warning?
fields.answer: A. A student who’s GPA in semester 1 or 2 is less than 2.00 will receive a warning notification.

fields.question: Q. Will I need textbooks?
fields.answer: A. Yes. Textbooks are needed to maximize your performance.  These can be purchased or rented at the University Bookshop or borrowed from the Science Library.

fields.question: Q. What must I do if I have missed an examination, laboratory exercise or other graded assignments due to medical reasons?
fields.answer: A. If you have missed an examination, laboratory exercise or other graded assignments due to medical reasons, you should submit a medical report from your attending physician to the UWI Health Centre as soon as possible where you will be further advised.

fields.question: Can I register for courses before payment?
fields.answer: Yes. However payment of fees must be made within the stipulated time frame given by the University.

fields.question: How do I get Financial Clearance?
fields.answer: Financial Clearance is granted under the following conditions:

fields.question: What are the fee payment options that are available to students?
fields.answer: In terms of fee payment, the following options are available:

fields.question: Can I pay for my miscellaneous fees and get my ID?
fields.answer: Yes. However, students are encouraged to have their receipt in their possession.

fields.question: Does the University offers a payment plan?
fields.answer: Yes. Payment plans are available on a per semester basis where students are granted a three months period to clear all balance. The Criteria are as follows:

fields.question: Where do I go if I am faced with financial difficulties?
fields.answer: A. Please consult the Office of Student Financing, Guild of Student Office or SAS.

fields.question: What are the policies governing the refund of tuition, miscellaneous and residence (hall) fees to students?
fields.answer: A refund of student tuition may be considered in the following cases:

fields.question: Q. What if I am unable to pursue my offer because of financial reason?
fields.answer: If a student is unable to pursue their offer in the current academic year; the student is required to defer.  Students can also make arrangements with the Admissions Section to resume their studies in Semester 2 of the said year if desire.

fields.question: What are the registration components and the rules that govern it?
fields.answer: Registration components and rules are as follows:

fields.question: How do I know which courses to register for?
fields.answer: All students are provided with a course listing which indicates the courses that they are to register for. Additionally, they can visit the Departments or Dean’s Office for academic counselling.

fields.question: Where can I get information about the English Language Proficiency Test?
fields.answer: Please contact the Department of Language, Linguistics and Philosophy in the Faculty of Humanities and Education or visit their homepage at http://www.mona.uwi.edu/dllp/language/elptu/

fields.question: Does the Faculty of Science and Technology award students for academic excellence?
fields.answer: Yes. The Faculty hosts an Annual Awards Ceremony to honor students who have obtained academic excellence.

fields.question: If I am unable to maintain the required GPA for my Scholarship, will it be revoked?
fields.answer: A Student scholarship may be revoked if the student performance is below the required GPA (cumulative) for the academic year.

fields.question: Are there awards that are offered by the Faculty?
fields.answer: Each department within the Faculty offers Departmental Awards to students that are usually course and or major specific.

fields.question: How can I get a part-time job on Campus?
fields.answer: As a full-time student you can seek part-time employment through the Office of Placement and Career Services.

fields.question: If I having personal issues where can I seek help?
fields.answer: Counseling services are provided by the University Health Centre.

fields.question: When do we get holidays?
fields.answer: Students are generally given the normal public holidays; in addition, they receive academic break between the third week of December and the third week of January. Summer breaks ranges from the third week of May to the third week of August.

fields.question: Are there clubs and societies in the Faculty and how can I be a part of it?
fields.answer: Yes.  Each department has club(s) or societies to which you can be involved.  These include:

fields.question: How many major campuses are there for the University of the West Indies?
fields.answer: The University of the West Indies has five (5) major campuses, all of which are located in the Caribbean:

fields.question: Is UWI a Religious University?
fields.answer: No. UWI is a secular institution of higher education embracing no religion or creed and open to men and women of all faiths and traditions, or no religious beliefs, purely on the basis of merit.

fields.question: What does the University's motto "Oriens Ex Occidente Lux" means?
fields.answer: “Light Rising from the West.”

fields.title: UWI Pesticide Research Lab Makes the ISO Mark
fields.description: The Pesticide Reasearch Laboratory (PRL) has earned the ISO 17025 certification, an international accreditation that adds prestige to the entity while promising to improve its bottom line...
fields.story:
The University of the West Indies, (UWI) Mona has signed a Memorandum of Understanding with the Ganja Growers and Producers Association of Jamaica to enable the University to engage independent contractors or other approved bodies in the growing of Cannabis Plants for the purpose of conducting research. The MOU was signed on Friday, April 24, 2015 at a ceremony held on The UWI, Mona Campus in Kingston, Jamaica.

The research on marijuana will be led by a newly established group at The UWI, Mona – the Cannabis Research Institute. Initially, the Institute will focus on identifying the different strains of local marijuana, how the different strains interact with the human body as well as products that may be derived from the plant. The work of the Institute will also have a direct economic impact on small farmers across Jamaica, some of whom will be contracted to produce the marijuana plants needed to facilitate the research. 

The MOU signing ceremony follows closely on the historic planting of Jamaica's first legal marijuana plant at The UWI, Mona Faculty of Medical Sciences Teaching & Research Complex on Monday, April 20, 2015. Both developments have been made possible by the granting of a licence to The UWI, Mona to grow marijuana for research purposes. The licence was granted under the provisions of a ministerial order issued by Minister of Science, Technology, Energy, and Mining Phillip Paulwell recently under Section 7 (d) of the Dangerous Drugs (Amendment) Act. The licence also permits the Mona Campus to engage independent contractors or other approved bodies in the growing of Cannabis Plants for the purpose of conducting research. 

The events highlight UWI's position as the pioneer in legally cultivating and researching the benefits of the drug in Jamaica. The UWI, Mona has long taken a lead role in the use of marijuana for medical purposes. The marijuana-based drug Canasol, used in the treatment of glaucoma, was pioneered by the late Professor Manley West of The UWI, Mona Department of Pharmacology. 

Mona Principal, Professor Archibald McDonald, serves as Chair of the Cannabis Commercial and Medicinal Research Task Force (CCMRT), an umbrella group, launched in September 2013. Participating organizations include The University of the West Indies; the University of Technology (UTECH), Jamaica; the Scientific Research Council; the Micro, Small, Medium Enterprises (MSME); the Jamaica Agricultural Society; Small Business Association of Jamaica; the Rastafarian Millennium Council; Ganja Law Reform Coalition (GLRC), and the National Alliance for the Legalization of Ganja (NALG), among others.

In 2014, The UWI, Mona signed a Memorandum of Understanding (MOU) with Timeless Herbal Care, a company which is involved in research into and the growing of herbal plants and with GenCanna Global, Inc., trading as Strains of Hope, to facilitate the conduct of research into the medicinal properties of marijuana (cannabis sativa). Strains of Hope are one of the largest marijuana growers and dispensary owners in Colorado, in the United States of America. 

The UWI, Mona also hosted a three-day Inaugural Jamaica Cannabis Conference, in May 2014

fields.title: Beware Interactions between Home Remedies and Medicine
fields.description: Sixty-four year old Johney Stewart is a fervent believer in the use of medicinal herbs to treat or inhibit certain medical conditions such as heart disease, high blood pressure...
fields.story:
Sixty-four year old Johney Stewart is a fervent believer in the use of medicinal herbs to treat or inhibit certain medical conditions such as heart disease, high blood pressure, high cholesterol, colds, flu and other infections.

Stewart uses garlic, for example, to treat chest pains. “I just cut up the garlic and swallow it, or boil it to make tea,” he said. He also uses it to flavour his meals and tenderize his meats. He is aware that one should not ingest too much garlic, but he believes he has mastered the art of “prescribing” his own dosage, especially since the formula was passed down from his ancestors. 

But Stewart, like so many Jamaicans, is unaware of the potential interactions of medicinal plants and foods with pharmaceutical drugs. According to Dr. Rupika Delgoda, head of the Natural Products Institute (NPI) at The UWI, Mona, this is quite a common phenomenon. She explained that about 23-25 per cent of the Jamaican population use pharmaceutical drugs in conjunction with medicinal plants. 

While this figure is not high, Dr. Delgoda and her team at the Natural Products Institute are taking steps to educate people about the dangers of mixing herbs with certain prescription drugs. Consequently, they conducted two field surveys in Jamaican pharmacies and one house-to-house survey across the general population. The individuals in the pharmacy were persons on prescription medication and the survey sought to determine whether these persons also selfmedicate. “We found that 80 per cent of them were actually using a medicinal plant,” Dr. Delgoda disclosed. “We also discovered from all three surveys that only 18 per cent of the doctors were aware of the fact that the patients were taking it [the medicinal plant]”.

Dr. David Picking, Research Fellow at the NPI added that the house-to-house survey revealed that 72 per cent of the Jamaican population use medicinal plants on a day-to-day basis. That fact motivated development of the handbook. However, Dr. Picking pointed out that the handbook, titled “Potential Drug Interactions for Commonly Used Medicinal Plants & Foods in Jamaica, was not compiled to discourage the use of these plants and herbs, but to support their safe use.

The handbook, a culmination of a decade of research, was compiled by Dr. Delgoda and Dr. Picking specifically for healthcare professionals, with their relevant patients in mind. It provides a list of 30 medicinal plants and foods, along with 70 potential drug interactions and several guidelines for monitoring their use. 

The handbook also includes the evidence on which the conclusions are based. For example, garlic, scientifically known as Allium sativum, may interact with antiplatelet and anticoagulant drugs, such as Warfarin. An interaction with garlic may increase bleeding time. 

According to the Handbook, the risk assessment is to monitor doses of fresh garlic over three grams and to stop taking at least one week before surgery. The evidence on which this is based includes reported cases, clinical studies and anecdotal reports. 

The handbook was officially launched on September 28, 2015 and is currently available for purchase at the UWI Bookshop, as well as at the Natural Products Institute. It is complemented by a user-friendly app and website, which will provide a quick point of reference for the medical community. NPI will also use the website to update new findings on these natural products. 

The Institute, an integrative research establishment within the Faculty of Science and Technology, is also carrying out research on the efficacy of herbs against cancer cells, as well as using natural products as cancer treatment leads and prevention leads. Additionally, new research is also being undertaken to understand the reason why mosquitoes, particularly Aedes aegypti mosquitoes, are so resistant to the existing insecticides on the market. The hope is to use natural products to eradicate these known carriers of dengue fever, chikungunya virus and zika virus.

In the near future, Dr. Delgoda also hopes to engage in research towards commercialization of of natural products, as well as position the Institute as an important academic partner and bridge for businesses and industry.

fields.title: Making Technology for Agriculture - Farming Inna Di City
fields.description: The UWI, Mona provides expertise to students with sustainable business initiatives through the Mona Business Support Services Support Incubator Programme. Business and engineering solutions firm EM2P, brainchild of current...
fields.story:
The UWI, Mona provides expertise to students with sustainable business initiatives through the Mona Business Support Services Incubator Programme.

Business and engineering solutions firm EM2P, brainchild of current and past students of the Faculty of Science & Technology, is incubated in the Department of Physics at The UWI, Mona and is now helping to shed new light on what it means to have technology infused into agriculture, to the benefit of local communities. The firm has built a solar power automated monitoring and water delivery system, designed to eliminate the dependence on external electricity sources and conserve water, while safeguarding crop yields.

The system is being used in the Jones Town-based urban agricultural pilot project dubbed “Farming Inna Di City”. Comprised of a 4,000-square foot greenhouse and five open-field plots manned and farmed by community members, the project is an initiative of Jones Town Baptist, their sister church Bethel Baptist, and the Jamaica Baptist Union Mission Agency. 

Six months on, EM2P’s has developed and installed their JMD650, 000 solar-powered IT system, which monitors the environment of the greenhouse and automatically delivers water to the plants. “[The system has] an electronic valve that turns on and off the pipe; sensors that tell us how saturated the soil is, including in it some remote monitoring and access that you can monitor from your phone from wherever in the world you are, as long as you have Internet access,” explained Chief Executive Officer Ian Scarlett, in a documentary film on the project.

The system also provides the added benefit of enabling community members to charge their cellphones free of cost. “It can provide communities with resilience during hurricane season if the Jamaica Public Service Company (JPS) power supply goes out. The system which can charge up to 10 devices simultaneously is scalable to upwards of a 100+ devices,” noted Chief Operations Officer Jayaka Campbell.

According to EM2P, their work with the project bodes well for the future of farming in Jamaica, as well as for their company. 

“Farming Inna Di City is set to be the model for a remote greenhouse installation system. It is designed from the ground up to be scalable and replicable with a low-maintenance cost after initial capital investment. The hope is that it will continue to evolve in its capabilities and become the go-to system for small and large greenhouses in the Caribbean and beyond,” said Noel Francis Jr, EM2P’s Chief Information Officer.

“This project is [also] a great opportunity to display the capabilities of the company, how technology can be used to solve immediate problems in our communities, and to remark on an outreach that involved the residents of the Jones Town community,” added Francis.

Denise Forest, chairman of the Central Management Committee for the project, had high praise for their efforts and the progress to date.

“I am not saying it has not had problems, it is not a prefect project, but that step of faith has resulted in some meaningful results... I am very pleased with the progress we have made. It has been a challenging time, but I think worthwhile,” she said.

Since inception, more than a dozen farmers – males and females – have been touched by the project, whether from work in the open fields or training forwork in the greenhouse.

There are currently two people employed fulltime at the greenhouse, but, Forest said, additional labour is periodically contracted for services, such as mending fences on the farm, which has produced items such as callaloo and lettuce. 

On next steps for Farming Inna Di City, Forest said the goal is on sustainability even as they look at options to diversify. “Being self-sustaining is now what we are focused on… As long as we have the energy and the ideas, we will continue the projects,” she said.

As for EM2P, representative Stefan Watson said: “EM2P will continue to develop innovative and cutting-edge solutions to solve some of the issues that plague all facets of the Jamaican society. We aim to develop solutions for the business, health, transportation education and social spheres, which will continuously aid in making a better Jamaica.”

“Additionally, we aim to provide opportunities to young graduates and final-year students, by offering internship positions. This will give them an opportunity to explore, create and express their creative geniuses without being made to endure the rigours of the traditional work place,” noted Scarlett of the firm, which offers not only consultation for technology products, but also web design services, database/ backend development and embedded system development.

fields.name: AFUWI Scholarships
fields.description: The award is available to students registered in the Undergraduate Degree programme
fields.detail:
### Number of Awards

To be decided by Donor

### Value

Between US$ 2,000-5000

### Maximum Tenure

One (1) year

### Eligibilty

The award is available to students registered in the Undergraduate Degree programme and:
  - Nationals of CARICOM countries;
  - Are registered in either the Faculty of Medical Sciences, Science and Technology,Humanities & Education or the Faculty of Social Sciences.
  - Are entering Level 2 or 3 of their programme of study in the Faculties of Humanities & Education, Science and Technology, Social Sciences;or Level 4 or 5 in the case of Medical Sciences students.
 
### Criteria

The award will be based on:

  - Academic performance based on results of the previous academic year University examinations (at least a GPA of 3.0);
  - Demonstrable leadership qualities;
  - Involvement in co-curricular and/or community-related activities.

### Method of Selection

Selection will be done by UWI officials in accordance with the established practice.

### Special Requirements

Applicants applying for more than one award should submit a SEPARATE application form when applying for this scholarship.

***Can be submitted on the same form as UWI Toronto Gala.

fields.name: Ambassador Glen A. Holden Bursary
fields.description: The award is available to Jamaican Nationals
fields.detail:
### Number of Awards

Four (4)

### Value

J$120,000 

### Maximum Tenure

One (1) year

### Eligibilty

The award is available to Jamaican Nationals who:
  - are registered in the Faculty of Science and Technology and  Humanities and Education at the Mona Campus;
  - have satisfactorily completed Level I of the degree programme;
  - participation in co-curricular activities and demonstrated leadership qualities.
 
### Criteria

The award will be based on:

  - High academic achievement (at least a GPA of 3.3)
  - Verifiable financial need

### Method of Selection

Shortlisted candidates will be interviewed by a committee comprising personnel from the U.W.I.

fields.name: Ambassador J. Gary Cooper Bursary
fields.description: Available to Jamaican Nationals who are entering level II or level III in the Faculties of Science and Technology, Social Sciences, Humanities & Education (one award per Faculty).

### Number of Awards

Four (4)

### Value

J$120,000 

### Maximum Tenure

One (1) year

### Eligibilty

Available to Jamaican Nationals who are entering level II or level III in the Faculties of Science and Technology, Social Sciences, Humanities & Education (one award per Faculty).
 
### Criteria

The award will be based on:

  - good academic performance;
  - verifiable financial need;
  - participation and leadership in co-curricular activities.

### Method of Selection

Shortlisted candidates will be interviewed by a committee comprising personnel from the University.

fields.name: Ambassador Sue Cobb Scholarship
fields.description: The award is available to Jamaica Nationals or students of Jamaican parentage.
fields.detail:
### Number of Awards

To be decided by Donor

### Value

Tuition

### Maximum Tenure

One (1) year

### Eligibilty

The award is available to Jamaica Nationals or students of Jamaican parentage who are:

  - registered at the UWI and will be entering their final year of study.
  
 
### Criteria

The award will be based on:

  - high academic performance in the last academic year's University examinations (at least a GPA of 3.3);
  - demonstrable leadership potential;
  - significant participation in co-curricular activities (e.g. sports, music and/or the arts).

### Method of Selection

Shortlisted candidates will be interviewed by a committee comprising personnel from the University and the JFHAA Scholarship Committee.

fields.name: Bevon Francis Bursary

fields.name: Carreras Ltd. Bursaries
fields.description: Available to Jamaican Nationals who are entering their second or final year in either the Faculties of Science and Technology, Social Sciences or Humanities & Education (Humanities based)
fields.detail:
### Number of Awards

Five (5)

### Value

$50,000.00 per annum

### Maximum Tenure

One (1) year.

### Eligibilty

Available to Jamaican Nationals who are entering their second or final year in either the Faculties of Science and Technology, Social Sciences or Humanities & Education (Humanities based).

  
 
### Criteria

The award will be based on:

  - good academic performance  (at least a GPA of 3.0);
  - verifiable financial need;
  - participation and leadership in co-curricular activities.

### How to Apply

- Obtain an application form from the Office of Student Financing

Return completed application form to the Office of Student Financing along with:

- One (1) copy (certified) of your official academic transcript
- One (1) copy (certified) of birth certificate, or other document showing evidence of age and nationality (Passport/Driver's Licence)
- One (1) copy of your resume
- One (1) copy of your University ID
- Two (2) Letters of reference - one academic and one character


### Please Note

There is a seperate application form for this award - DO NOT USE THE OSF APPLICATION FORM- Collect a form from the Office of Student Financing, UWI Mona

fields.name: CCRIF SPC-UWI Undergraduate Scholarship
fields.description: Available to CARICOM Nationals
fields.detail:
### Number of Awards

Four (4)

### Value

US$4,000 per annum

### Maximum Tenure

Two (2) years

### Eligibilty

Available to CARICOM Nationals who:
  
  - are registered students  in the Faculty of Science & Technology majoring in Geography or Geology;
  - are registered in the Faculty of Humanities & Education majoring in Geography;
  - will be entering Level 2 of the B.Sc. degree programme.

  
 
### Criteria

The award will be based on:

  - High academic performance (at least a GPA of 3.0)

### Method of Selection

Short-listed candidates will be selected by a panel comprising personnel from the  UWI with recommendations made in selecting the final candidates.


### Condition

The recipeints is expected to:
  
   - be registered full-time;
   - be a second (2nd) year student for the 2016/2017 academic year.

### How to Apply

Submit the completed application form with all the other relevant documents to the Office of Student Financing on or before May 31, 2016.

### Please Note

Students who have withdrawn from the programme without good reason and the approval of the Academic Director, or who fail to complete the programme, will be required to repay the award.

fields.name: Digicel Scholarships
fields.description: The award is available to Caribbean Nationals entering Level 2 or 3 of their study at the Mona Campus
fields.detail:
### Number of Awards

Three (3)

### Value

J$145,000 

### Maximum Tenure

One (1) year.

### Eligibilty

The award is available to Caribbean Nationals entering Level 2 or 3 of their study at the Mona Campus and registered in either:
  
  - the Faculty of Science & Technology or Humanities & Education with a major in Physics, Electronics, Digital Technology or Computer Science;
  - ### OR
  - the Faculty of Social Sciences with a major in Management Studies (Accounting, Finance, Marketing or Human Resources)

  
 
### Criteria

The award will be based on:

  - academic performance (at least a GPA of 3.3);
  - verifiable financial need;
  - demonstrable involvement in co-curricular activities.

### Method of Selection

Shortlisted candidates will be interviewed by a panel consisting of UWI Representatives and the Donor.

fields.name: Douane Henry Memorial Bursary (The)

fields.detail:
### Number of Awards

One (1)

### Value

$100,000.00

### Maximum Tenure

One (1) Year

### Eligibilty

The award is available to Jamaican Nationals with disabilities who are:
  
  - pursuing studies leading to a first degree in any faculty;
  - entering level two;
  - registered with the Jamaica Council for Persons with Disabilities (JCPD) and the Office for Special Students Services (OSSS).

  
 
### Criteria

The award will be based on:

  - high academic achievement;
  - verifiable financial need;
  - involvement in co-curricular activities.

### Method of Selection

Short-listed candidates will be interviewed by a panel comprising personnel from the Office of Special Student Services, Lions Club of Mona and Family of Dr. Keith Peart.

### Condition

Applicants must be able to show evidence of involvement in co-curricular activities.

fields.name: Enid Jones-Forrester Memorial Student Grant
fields.description: The award is available to full time registered students
fields.detail:
### Number of Awards

One (1)

### Value

20,000.00

### Maximum Tenure

One year

### Eligibilty

The award is available to full time registered students who are:

  - 17-25 years

### Criteria

The award will be based on:

  - Academic performance of at least a GPA of 3.0

### Method of Selection

fields.name: Glencore AG Scholarship
fields.description: Applicants should be accepted for full time study in the field of Science and Technology or Sport
fields.detail:
### Number of Awards

Three (3)

### Value

J$325,000.00

### Maximum Tenure

Three (3) years

### Eligibilty

Applicants should:
  
  - be below the age of thirty (30) years of age on Oct 1, 2016;
  - have resided for at least five years in one of the bauxite parishes of St. Catherine, Clarendon, Manchester, St. Ann or St. Elizabeth;
  - be accepted for full time study in the field of Science and Technology or Sport or;
  - already in a programme of undergraduate study in any of the above mentioned fields of study at a University and having a minimum B average.

### Method of Selection

Only shortlisted candidates will receive notification.

### How to Apply

A completed SPECIAL application from along with supporting documents MUST be returned to:

The Managing Director

Bauxite & Alumina Trading Co.

36 Trafalgar Road

Kingston 10

### Please Note

Scholarship Applications MUST be downloaded from the following link:

http://www.mgd.gov.jm/services/products/guide-to-quarry-licence.html?vie....


Additionally, completed application forms with accompaning documents are to be submitted at

PCJ Building, 36 Trafalgar Road Kingston 10

fields.name: H.A. "Charlie" Braham Memorial Scholarship
fields.description: The award is available to Jamaican Nationals
fields.detail:
### Number of Awards

One (1) 

### Value

$50,000 per annum

### Maximum Tenure

Three (3) years

### Eligibilty

The award is available to Jamaican Nationals who are:
  
  - academic performance in the Advanced Level Examinations or the University Examinations (Preliminary Level);
  - verifiable financial need;
  - involvement in co-curricular activities;
  - demonstrable leadership qualities.

### Method of Selection

Short-listed candidates will be interviewed by a panel comprising UWI and Donor personnel.

### Condition

The recipient of this award will be expected to work in Jamaica for a minimum of one (1) year immediately after graduation.

### Please Note

Children of Rotarians are not eligible for this award.

fields.name: Jamaica Government Exhibition
fields.description: The award is open to Jamaican Nationals
fields.detail:
### Number of Awards

Fifteen (15) per annum

### Value

Tuition & contribution towards book grant

### Maximum Tenure

Regular duration of specified programme

### Eligibilty

The award is open to Jamaican Nationals who are:
  
  - enetering Level (Ι) or Level (ΙΙ) of an undergraduate degree programme (not full fee paying) in any Faculty of the University of the West Indies, Mona Campus;
  - not older than 25 years of age at the start of the academic year for which they are applying.

### Criteria

Students are required to:

 - have high academic performance in at least three (3) subjects at CAPE Units Ι and ΙΙ and either Communication or Caribbean Studies
 - #### OR
 - have attained at least a Grade Point Average (GPA) of 3.30 at Level Ι of the UWI examinations;
 - have verifiable financial need;
 - be involved in co-curricular and/or community service activities;
 - possess strong leadership qualities.


### Method of Selection

Shortlisted candidates will be interviewed by a panel comprising personnel from the Ministry of Education, Principal's Association and the University of the West Indies.

### Condition

Graduates will be required to serve in Jamaica for a minimum period of two years immediately after graduation. The bonding period will be determined by the Ministry of Finance and subject to the amount of money expended.

fields.name: Jamaica Police Co-operative Credit Union Scholarship- DEADLINE JULY 25, 2016
fields.description: The award is available to students
fields.detail:
### Deadline

Monday, July 25, 2016

### Number of Awards

One (1)

### Value

J$165,000.00

### Maximum Tenure

One (1)

### Eligibilty

The award is available to students who are:
  
  - Jamaican nationals;
  - Undergraduate students registered in any Faculty of UWI;
  - members of the Jamaica Police Co-orperative Credit Union Limited for a period of not less than 2 years or the child of a qualified member of the JPCCU.

### Criteria

The award will be based on:

 - High academic performance (at least a GPA of 3.0);
 - Strong leadership qualities;
 - Verifiable financial need.
 - Performace at Interview


### Method of Selection

Short-listed candidates applicants will be interviewed by a panel comprising personnel from the Donors and UWI.


### Condition

The recipient is required to maintain a GPA of 3.0 and will be required to work in Jamaica for a minimum of two (2) years.

fields.name: Jamaican American Friendship Association (JAFA) Bursary
fields.description: The award is available to Jamaica Nationals or students of Jamaican parentage
fields.detail:
### Number of Awards

One (1)

### Value

J$100,000 

### Maximum Tenure

One (1) year

### Eligibilty

The award is available to Jamaica Nationals or students of Jamaican parentage who are:
  
  - registered at the UWI and will be entering their final year of study;
  - Full time student registered in the Faculty of Humanities & Education, Science & Technology or Social Sciences

### Criteria

The award will be based on:

 - high academic performance in the last academic year's University examinations (at least a GPA of 3.0);
 - demonstrable community engagement & social awareness;
 - verifiable financial need.


### Method of Selection

Short-listed candidates will be interviewed by a committee comprising personnel from the University and the Donor Committee.


### Special Requirements

The recipeint will be required to:
 - Participate in a major project that JAFA undertakes;
 - Visit the organization on a meeting day whenever possible.

fields.name: Joe Pereira Scholarship (The)
fields.description: The award is available to students
fields.detail:
### Number of Awards

One (1)

### Value

$250,000 per annum

### Maximum Tenure

One (1) year

### Eligibilty

The award is available to students:
  
  - Jamaican national;
  - Registered in a full-time government sponsored undergraduate degree programme tenable in the Faculty of Science and Technology OR the Faculty Social Sciences OR the Faculty of Humanities & Education ;
  -  entering Level Two (2) or Three (3) of the degree programme.

### Criteria

The award shall be based on:

 - high academic achievement (at least a minimum cumilative GPA of 3.3);
 - verifiable financial need.


### Method of Selection

Short-listed candidates shall be interviewed by a panel comprising personnel from the University and WIGUT (Jamaica).


### Condition

The recipient is expected to participate in fifty (50) hours of voluntary service  in an area of service approved by WIGUT (Jamaica).

fields.name: Keats Hall/UWIDEF Environmental Scholarship
fields.description: The award is available to undergarduate students
fields.detail:
### Number of Awards

Two (2)

### Value

$250,000 per annum

### Maximum Tenure

One (1) year

### Eligibilty

The award is available to undergarduate students who are:
  
  - Jamaican nationals;
  - registered in the Faculty of Science & Technology pursuing studies in Environmental Studies;
  -  Entering year 2 or 3

### Criteria

The award shall be based on:

 - High academic performance (at least a GPA of 3.0);
 - Strong leadership qualities;
 - Verifiable financial need.


### Method of Selection

Short-listed candidates will be interviewed by a panel comprising personnel from the Donor organization and UWI.

### Condition

The recipient is required to complete one hundred (100) hours of voluntary service to The Forest Conservancy OR any other apppropriate environmental programme.

fields.name: Mill Reef Fund Education Grant
fields.description: The award is available to citizens or registered certificate holders of Antigua & Barbuda
fields.detail:
### Number of Awards

One (1)

### Value

Maximum US $16,000.00

### Maximum Tenure

Three/Five (3/5) years (based on programme & faculty regulations)

### Eligibilty

The award is available to:
  
  - Citizens or registered certificate holders of Antigua & Barbuda;
  - Undergraduate students registered in any faculty;
  - Entering any level/year.

### Criteria

The award will be based on high academic performance

### Method of Selection

Shortlisted candidates will be selected by personnel from the University community. 

### Condition

The sucessful candidate shall NOT be:

  - the holder or recipient of any other Scholarship or Grant support;
  - the island Scholar, as defined by the Antigua's National Scholarship Committee.

### Special Requirements For First Year entrants:

Application shall be accompanied with the following documents:

  - Secondary school transcripts;
  - One page essay on the applicant's educational goals;
  - Two character references.

fields.name: NAJASO*/Marcus Mosiah Garvey Scholarship (*National Association of Jamaica and Supportive Organization)
fields.description: The award is available to Jamaican Nationals
fields.detail:
### Number of Awards

One (1)

### Value

To be decided by the Donor 

### Maximum Tenure

Three (3) years.

### Eligibilty

The award is available to Jamaican Nationals who are:
  
  - residing in Jamaica;
  - enrolled in Level I of the degree programme at Mona Campus (i.e. must be in their first year of study at UWI, Mona);
  - in the Faculties of Humanities & Education (Arts-Based only), Science and Technology, Social Sciences.

### Criteria

The award is available to:

  - residing in Jamaica;
  - Leadership qualities;
  - Verifiable financial need.

### Method of Selection

Shortlisted candidates applicants will be interviewed by a panel comprising personnel from UWI.

### Condition

The recipient is required to serve in Jamaica for a minimum period of three (3) years immediately after graduation.

fields.name: Office of Student Financing Scholarship
fields.description: The award is available to Jamaican Nationals with or without disabilities
fields.detail:
### Number of Awards

One (1)

### Value

J$150,000 

### Maximum Tenure

One (1) year.

### Eligibilty

The award is available to Jamaican Nationals with or without DISABILITIES who are:
  
  - pursuing studies leading to a first degree in the Faculty of Science and Technology (Computer Science or Environmental Science majors)
  - ### OR
  - pursuing studies leading a degree in the Faculty of Social Sciences (Dept. of Sociology, Psychology & Social Work).

### Criteria

The award will be based on:

  - high academic achievement;
  - verifiable financial need;
  - involvement in co-curricular activities.

### Method of Selection

Short-listed candidates will be interviewed and the recipient selected by personnel from the Office of Student Financing.

fields.name: Pottinger Scholarship for Needy Students
fields.description: The award is available to Jamaican Nationals
fields.detail:
### Number of Awards

One (1)

### Value

J$120,000 

### Maximum Tenure

One (1) year.

### Eligibilty

The award is available to Jamaican Nationals who:
  
  - are entering their final year of study in a full-time degree programme within either the Faculties of Humanities & Education, Science and Technology or Social Sciences and
  - have had holiday job experience.

### Criteria

The award will be based on:

  - high academic achievement;
  - verifiable financial need;
  - involvement in community activities. 

### Method of Selection

Short-listed candidates will be interviewed by a panel comprised of UWI and donor personnel.

fields.name: Principal's Scholarship For Excellence (The)
fields.description: The award is available to students registered in the Undergraduate Degree programme
fields.detail:
### Value

Tuition and Miscellaneous Expenses

### Maximum Tenure

One (1) or Two (2) Years

### Eligibilty

The award is available to students registered in the Undergraduate Degree programme and:
  
  - Are registered in any faculty;
  - Are entering Level II or III of their programme of study. 

### Criteria

The award will be based on:

  - Academic performance based on results of the previous academic year University examinations (at least a GPA of 3.3);
  - Demonstrable leadership qualities;
  - Involvement in co-curricular and/or community-related activities.

fields.name: Ralph & Ricky Lauren Bursaries (The)
fields.description: Available to Jamaican Nationals who are entering their final year in the Faculties of Medical Sciences, Science and Technology, Social Sciences, Humanities & Education (one award per Faculty).
fields.detail:
### Number of Award(s)

Four (4)

### Value

J$100,000 

### Maximum Tenure

One (1) year.

### Eligibilty

Available to Jamaican Nationals who are entering their final year in the Faculties of Medical Sciences, Science and Technology, Social Sciences, Humanities & Education (one award per Faculty).

### Criteria

The award will be based on:

  - good academic performance;
  - verifiable financial need;
  - participation and leadership in co-curricular activities.

### Method of Selection

Shortlisted candidates will be interviewed by a committee comprising personnel from the University.

fields.name: Sherwin Williams (Science) Scholarship
fields.description: Available to Jamaican Nationals
fields.detail:
### Number of Award(s)

One (1)

### Value

J$100,000 per annum

### Maximum Tenure

Three (3) years

### Eligibilty

Available to Jamaican Nationals who:

  - are registered in the Faculty of Science & Technology;
  - will be entering the Introductory or Advanced Part of the B.Sc. degree programme;
  - intends to pursue a major in Chemistry;
  - are not more than 21 years of age.


### Criteria

The award will be based on:

  - high academic performance based on results of the CAPE Units I and II and the GCE Advanced Level Examinations or Year I of the University Examinations;
  - verifiable financial need

### Method of Selection

The recipient is expected to serve in Jamaica for a minimum period of two (2) years immediately after graduation.







































### Number of Award(s)

One (1)

### Value

J$100,000 per annum

### Maximum Tenure

Three (3) years

### Eligibilty

Available to Jamaican Nationals who:

  - are registered in the Faculty of Science & Technology;
  - will be entering the Introductory or Advanced Part of the B.Sc. degree programme;
  - intends to pursue a major in Chemistry;
  - are not more than 21 years of age.


### Criteria

The award will be based on:

  - high academic performance based on results of the CAPE Units I and II and the GCE Advanced Level Examinations or Year I of the University Examinations;
  - verifiable financial need

### Method of Selection

Short listed candidates will be interviewed by a committee comprising UWI and donor personnel.

### Condition

The recipient is expected to serve in Jamaica for a minimum period of two (2) years immediately after graduation.

fields.name: Stanley Greig Memorial Scholarship
fields.description: The award is available to Jamaican Nationals
fields.detail:
### Number of Award(s)

One (1)

### Value

$75,000 per annum

### Maximum Tenure

One (1) year.

### Eligibilty

The award is available to Jamaican Nationals who are:

  - pursuing studies on the Mona Campus leading to a first degree in Computer Sciences (in either the Faculty of Humanities & Education or the Faculty of Science & Technology) and
  - entering the final year of the degree programme.


### Criteria

The award will be based on:

  - high academic achievement in the Level 2 University Examinations (at least a GPA of 3.3);
  - verifiable financial need;
  - demonstrable leadership qualities in co-curricular activities.

### Method of Selection

Shortlisted candidates will be interviewed by a panel comprising personnel from the University and representatives of the donor agency.

fields.name: Stephen Alleyne Memorial Scholarship (The)
fields.description: The award is available to students who are Caricom nationals
fields.detail:
### Number of Award(s)

One (1)

### Value

US $2,000.00

### Maximum Tenure

One (1) year.

### Eligibilty

The award is available to students who are:

  - Caricom nationals;
  - final year students pursuing a B.Sc. in the faculty of Science and Technology, Mona Campus (majoring in Actuarial Science).


### Criteria

The award will be based on:

  - high academic achievement in the annual University Examinations (at least a GPA of 3.3);
  - verifiable financial need.

### Condition

Short-listed candidates will be interviewed by a panel comprising personnel from the Caribbean Actuarial Association and the University of the West Indies.

fields.name: University Lodge of the West Indies/Francis Haddon Bowen Scholarship
fields.description: The award is available to Jamaican Nationals
fields.detail:
### Number of Award(s)

One (1)

### Value

J$150,000

### Maximum Tenure

One (1) Year

### Eligibilty

The award is available to students who are:

  - registered in their final year of a full time undergraduate programme at the Mona Campus;
  - pursuing a degree in the Faculty of Science and Technology (depts. of Computer Science OR Physics OR Electronics)


### Criteria

The award will be based on:

  - high academic performance (results of the previous academic year University examinations (at least a GPA of 3.0);
  - verifiable financial need;
  - demonstrable involvement in co-curricular activities.

### Method of Selection

Selections will be done by the Donor on the recommendation of the UWI.

fields.name: UWI Academic Bursaries
fields.description: Available to full-time students from ALL Faculties
fields.detail:
### Value

J$30,000 per annum

### Eligibilty

Available to full-time students from ALL Faculties who are:

  - enrolled in either level II or III of the 3-year degree programme OR Years 2, 3 or 4
  - of the M.B.B.S. Programme


### Criteria

The award will be based on academic performance based on applicant's records with special reference to his/her performance in the most recent University Examination . A GPA of at least 3.3 is expected.

### Method of Selection

Short-listed candidates will be selected by representatives from the UWI.

fields.name: UWI Toronto Gala Scholarship
fields.description: The award is available to Jamaican Nationals
fields.detail:
### Number of Award(s)

Twelve (12).

### Value

CAN$3,000

### Eligibilty

The award is available to Jamaican Nationals who are:

  - registered full-time in the Faculty of Medical Sciences, Science and Technology, Humanities & Education & Social Sciences;
  - entering level two (2) of their B.Sc. degree programme.


### Criteria

The award is based on:

 - Maintenance of a high level of academic performance (GPA of 3.0 or above);
 - Demonstrable involvement in co-curricular activities;
 - Verifiable financial need.


### Method of Selection

The successful candidate(s) will be selected by a Committee comprising personnel from the Donor and U.W.I.

### Special Requirements

Applicants applying for more than one award should submit a SEPARATE application form when applying for this scholarship.

*** Can be submitted on the same form as AFUWI Scholarships.






























### Number of Award(s)

Twelve (12).

### Value

CAN$3,000

### Maximum Tenure

One (1) year

### Eligibilty

The award is available to Jamaican Nationals who are:

  - registered full-time in the Faculty of Medical Sciences, Science and Technology, Humanities & Education & Social Sciences;
  - entering level two (2) of their B.Sc. degree programme.


### Criteria

The award is based on:

 - Maintenance of a high level of academic performance (GPA of 3.0 or above);
 - Demonstrable involvement in co-curricular activities;
 - Verifiable financial need.


### Method of Selection

The successful candidate(s) will be selected by a Committee comprising personnel from the Donor and U.W.I.

### Special Requirements

Applicants applying for more than one award should submit a SEPARATE application form when applying for this scholarship.

*** Can be submitted on the same form as AFUWI Scholarships.

fields.name: UWI Visa Card Scholarship
fields.description: The award is available to students registered in an Undergraduate Degree programme
fields.detail:
### Number of Award(s)

Ten(10) annually.

### Value

J$200,000.00

### Maximum Tenure

Two (2) years

### Eligibilty

The award is available to:

  - Students registered in an Undergraduate Degree programme;
  - Students from any Faculty;
  - Students entering Level II or III (Two or Three); in the case of Medical Sciences Level IV or V (Four or Five) of their programme of study.


### Criteria

The award will be based on:

 - Performance based on the previous academic years' UWI examinations (GPA of at least 3.0);
 - Involvement in co-curricular or community activities;
 - Verifiable financial need;
 - Demonstrable leadership potential.


### Method of Selection

Short-listed candidates will be selected by University personnel.

### Special Requirements

The successful applicants will be required to do 50 hours of voluntary service with The Institutional Advancement Division as assigned by Donor.

fields.name: UWI(Mona) & Community Co-op/Ezra Lewis Memorial Scholarship
fields.description: The award is available to individuals who are members of the University of The West Indies (Mona) & Community Co-Operative Credit Union
fields.detail:
### Number of Award(s)

Two (2)

### Value

J$150,000 per annum (each)

### Maximum Tenure

One (1) year.

### Eligibilty

The award is available to:

  - Individuals who are members of the University of The West Indies (Mona) & Community Co-Operative Credit Union for at least one year or the spouse or child of such a member; [The member's account held at the Credit Union MUST be active at the time of application.]
  - Students pursuing undergraduate degree courses at UWI Mona Campus, University of Technology, Teachers Colleges or any other recognized Tertiary institution locally or overseas;
  - Students in their second or third year of study but in the case of MB,BS Students, the first year of Stage 1 of the programme must be completed.


### Criteria

The award will be based on:

 - Academic performance based on the results of the previous academic year University examinations (at least a GPA of 3.3);
 - Verifiable financial need;
 - Involvement in co-curricular activities.

### Method of Selection

Shortlisted candidates will be interviewed by personnel from the Administration of the UWI and a representative from the Credit Union.

### Please Note

At the bottom section of the first page, please write the name of the branch, the name of the account holder, and the savings account number relating to the acount being held at UWI (Mona) & Community Co-op. Credit Union.

The member's account held at the Credit Union MUST be active at the time of application.

fields.name: UWIDEF Bursary for the Performing Arts
fields.description: The award is available to any Caribbean National
fields.detail:
### Number of Award(s)

Two (2)

### Value

$100,000

### Maximum Tenure

One (1) year

### Eligibilty

The award is available to any Caribbean National who is:

  - registered in any undergraduate degree programme
  - entering level two (2) or three (3)


### Criteria

The award will be based on:

 - High academic performance (at least a GPA of 3.0);
 - Demonstrable financial need;
 - Membership in a performing arts group on campus for at least one (1) year

### Method of Selection

Shortlisted candidates will be interviewed by a panel consisting of representatives from Phillip Sherlock Centre for the Creative Arts, Office of Students Services and Development, and UWI Endowment Fund. 

### Condition

The recipients are required to complete 40 hours of voluntary service with the UWI Development Fund.

### Please Note

Priority will be given to students who are involved in performing arts at UWI Mona or Western Jamaica Campus, consideration will be given to students involved in performing arts groups outside of UWI. 

Proof of active membership is required.

fields.name: UWIDEF Undergraduate Scholarships
fields.description: The award is available to Jamaica Nationals
fields.detail:
### Number of Award(s)

Four (4)

### Value

J$250,000 (2 awards), J$125,000 (2 awards)

### Maximum Tenure

One (1) year

### Eligibilty

The award is available to Jamaica Nationals or students of Jamaican parentage who are:

  - Full time student registered in all Faculties EXCEPT Medical Sciences;
  - Entering LEVEL (year) 2 or 3 of study;


### Criteria

The award will be based on:

 - high academic performance in the last academic year's University examinations (at least a GPA of 3.3);
 - Verifiable financial need.

### Method of Selection

Short-listed candidates will be interviewed by a committee comprising personnel from the University and the Donor Committee.

### Condition

The recipients are required to complete 100 hours or 50 hours of voluntary services with the UWI Development and Endowmnet Fund (UWIDEF) or any organization within the UWI community.

fields.name: WIGUT Bursaries (Offered by the West Indies Group of University Teachers, Jamaica (WIGUT))
fields.description: The award is available to Jamaican Nationals
fields.detail:
### Number of Award(s)

To be decided by the Donor.

### Value

$40,000 per annum

### Maximum Tenure

Two (2) years (students in the MB,BS degree programme may be granted extended tenure) 

### Eligibilty

The award is available to Jamaican Nationals who are:

  - pursuing studies on the Mona Campus leading to a first degree in any faculty;
  - entering the Level II or Level III of the degree programme.


### Criteria

The award will be based on:

 - high academic achievement in the annual University Examinations (at least a GPA of 3.3);
 - demonstrable financial need.

### Method of Selection

Short-listed candidates will be selected by a panel comprising personnel from the University and the WIGUT (Jamaica).

fields.name: Young Jamaican Scholar Book Grant
fields.description: The award is availbale to students who are Jamaican nationals
fields.detail:
### Number of Award(s)

Two (2)

### Value

J$40,000

### Maximum Tenure

One (1) year

### Eligibilty

The award is availbale to students who are:

  - Jamaican nationals;
  - Full time students registerd in either the Faculty of Humanities & Education, Science and Technology or Social Sciences;
  - Entering levels two (2) or three (3) at the Mona Campus.

### Criteria

The award will be based on:

 - academic achievement (at least a GPA of 3.0)
 - demonstrable financial need;
 - participation in co-curricular activities (e.g. sports/ music/ clubs or societies).

### Method of Selection

The successful candidate(s) will be selected by a Committee comprising personnel from the Donor and U.W.I.
